Hi, i'm sorry maybe im missing something plainly obvious here, but how does one get their own saved game on dawnguard, rather than lasteno's?

though he does have a nice character, i'm just fond of mine,

*** CONVERTING SAVED GAMES FROM OLD VERSIONS OF SKYRIM ***

 (to dyvog and anyone else who is eager to convert their own saves to the new version):

I looked for my saves in my old version of Skyrim, which I downloaded in November 2011 as a torrent from thepiratebay (can't remember which torrent exactly). Originally they were really hard to find, but I eventually hunted them down by looking for subdirectories that changed size when I saved.

Saves (.ess files) don't show up in Finder search. You can, however, find them in Finder if you navigate directly to the right folder.

I found mine here:

/Games/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim.app/Contents/Resources/transgaming/c_drive/Program Files/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/%USERPROFILE%/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim/Saves/

Note that I installed Skyrim in a folder in root called "Games"; yours might be in "Applications" instead, but the rest of the path information will be accurate if you use the same version Regarding saved games (to dyvog and anyone else who is eager to convert their own saves to the new version):

I looked for my saves in my old version of Skyrim, which I downloaded in November 2011 as a torrent from thepiratebay (can't remember which torrent exactly). Originally they were really hard to find, but I eventually hunted them down by looking for subdirectories that changed size when I saved.

Saves (.ess files) don't show up in Finder search. You can, however, find them in Finder if you navigate directly to the right folder.

I found mine here:

/Applications/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim.app/Contents/Resources/transgaming/c_drive/Program Files/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/%USERPROFILE%/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim/Saves/

This path information will be strictly accurate only if you use the same version of the port that I do. Even if not, this should give people a hint about where to look.

I copied one of my save files into this location in the new Skyrim/Dawnguard app (i.e., downloaded using this torrent:

/Applications/Elder Scrolls V - Skyrim Dawnguard.app/Contents/Resources/drive_c/users/Wineskin/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim/Saves/of the port that I do. Even if not, this should give people a hint about where to look.

Then when I launched Skyrim+Dawnguard, my old game was in the "LOAD" menu.

I am encountering one weird problem, which is that I am having trouble with key mapping.

In inventory management, the key that is indicated as "favorite" (F by default) triggers the "drop" response. The key for dropping doesn't seem to do anything. There are a few other problems like this. 

It doesn't seem to extent to keymapping in normal play - I changed lasteno's movement keys to my usual WASD, and those work fine.

Has anyone else encountered this problem? If so, do you know how to fix it? I'm going to try moving around some of the preferences files from my old version of the game to the new one, but I would love some guidance if anyone knows how to fix this.

Thanks in advance...

@mycophage, I have encountered that, I just kind of mashed on my keyboard until I figured everything out. From what I remember off of the top of my head, z is now the key to refill enchanted weapons, but there were two other keys that were improperly mapped, not that big of a deal after a while of gameplay though.

Thanks, though that's not a very satisfying solution - I've been playing a long time and I like my key mappings. 

Besides, the app clearly "thinks" that the keys are mapped differently, because the legend at the bottom of the inventory screen has the standard mappings. 

Anyone know where these preferences are stored?

I'll play around with this later today and post if I figure it out.

I found it. There's a key map file called ControlMap_Custom.txt. 

In my old version of Skyrim, this file was here:

/Applications/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim.app/Contents/Resources/transgaming/c_drive/Program Files/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/

I copied it into this folder:

/Applications/Elder Scrolls V - Skyrim Dawnguard.app/Contents/Resources/drive_c/Program Files/The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim/

replacing a file of the same name.

All the keys work now!

I copied it into this loc
^^^ (I should have said, this imported my own key mappings and fixed the problems with default keys not working in the inventory management screen)

I was ecstatic when I got this working for my macbook pro... @knowsnada can I ask you a favor? can you test these settings for me? seeing as we both share the same specs...

enable GLSL
- right click on skyrim > show package content
- from there, open wineskin
- select advanced
- select tools and under utilities you will find winetrick, select it
- search for GLSL, it should be under settings, tick and select run.

force use xquartz
-follow step 1 to 2 above and select options, it should be the last option.

automatic screen setting (doubt this has anything to do with the game)
- repeat step 1 to 2, select set screen options on the bottom.
-override controls with these setting are changed to automatic from override
... I'll try that. Just need to figure out what glsl is. I got wineskin and the like.
I'm also running a macbook pro with Lion so I tried what you suggested Chikoiwangko... still no luck. How about you knowsnada?

huh, could be something else I have done to the wrapper, but only the things I have posted before seems to have a significant effect on the wrapper, mainly GLSL... I'll post what I settings I have changed  and update on my skyrim wrapper...

-GLSL enable
-force xquartz
-screen setting override with rootless (windowed)
-graphics setting (in game) set to default (as mentioned by someone before)

oh, and this might be a hindsight but I'm running on 10.6.8 but this should be the problem as I'm running on xquartz rather than X11.
@knowsnada GLSL is preinstalled on the wineskin wrapper, it is disabled by default as some mac are able to run shader model 3.0 without it.
